meanings.definition: To suppose that something is the case on the basis of probability or evidence.
meanings.sent1: She presumes the sun will rise tomorrow because it always has.
meanings.sent2: He presumes the package will arrive by Friday.
meanings.sent3: The cat presumes the closed door is hiding a secret catnip stash.
meanings.sent4: The detective presumes the suspect's innocence until proven guilty.
meanings.sent5: The scientist presumes the theory to be true until further experiments disprove it.

meanings.definition: To take for granted or assume something to be true without proof.
meanings.sent1: The teacher presumes the students have completed their homework.
meanings.sent2: She presumes he will always be there for her.
meanings.sent3: The child presumes the cookie jar is always full of cookies.
meanings.sent4: The author presumes the reader will understand the underlying themes.
meanings.sent5: The chef presumes the recipe will turn out perfectly every time.

meanings.definition: To act or proceed with unwarrantable boldness.
meanings.sent1: He presumes to speak on behalf of the entire group without permission.
meanings.sent2: She presumes to enter the meeting without an invitation.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel presumes to steal nuts from the bird feeder in broad daylight.
meanings.sent4: The toddler presumes to climb the tall bookshelf despite being told not to.
meanings.sent5: The explorer presumes to cross the treacherous river alone.
